value: You can create scrolls of any spell that you know.  To scribe a scroll, you must use up raw materials costing the same as the scroll's sale price, as well as expending any costly material components.

You can create potions of any 3rd-level or lower spell that you know that targets one or more creatures or objects.  To brew a potion, you must use up raw materials costing the same as the potion's sale price, as well as expending any costly material components.

You can create wands of any 4th-level or lower spell that you know.  A newly created wand has 50 charges.  To craft a wand, you must use up raw materials costing the same as the wand's sale price, as well as expending 50 times any expensive material components.
You can create a wide variety of magic wondrous items, such as amulets, belts, boots, cloaks, gloves and headbands, but not rings.
You can upgrade weapons, armor, or shields with magical enhancements. Weapons to be enchanted must be at least masterwork quality.
You can create or upgrade magic rings.

In addition, you have had further enchanting done:
A complex process involving metallurgy and alchemy can bond silver to a weapon made of steel so that it bypasses the damage reduction of creatures such as lycanthropes.

This iron, mined deep underground and known for its effectiveness against demons and fey creatures, is forged at a lower temperature to preserve its delicate properties. Weapons made of cold iron cost twice as much to make as their normal counterparts, including costing twice as much to initially enchant the weapon to +1.

Weapons fashioned from adamantine have a natural ability to bypass hardness when sundering weapons or attacking objects, ignoring hardness less than 20.  Adamantine requires so much skill to work that weapons made from it are always of masterwork quality.

This ring continually provides its wearer with life-sustaining nourishment. The ring also refreshes the body and mind, so that its wearer needs only sleep 2 hours per day to gain the benefit of 8 hours of sleep. This allows them to perform two roles in camp.

This special ability can only be placed on melee weapons that are not light weapons. An impact weapon delivers a potent kinetic jolt when it strikes, dealing damage as if the weapon were one size category larger.

A corrosive burst weapon functions as a corrosive weapon that also explodes with acid upon striking a successful critical hit. The acid does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra 1d6 acid damage from the corrosive ability, a corrosive burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of acid damage on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of acid damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points of acid damage.
